messages.message:
Thank you @Jessica. The points above, since when have they been in affect? Because I have to show what has been changed since the June release to address them.

Be great to get some input from @Heymian as well

4 - What do they mean by “idle”. The thing we can configure is “session_auto_timeout_minutes” which will check the session timeout upon any action taken by the user. E.g. if the timeout is 1hr, anytime after an hr, if the user tries to do anything on the website, they will be logged out. But we do not, proactively, at the 1hr mark force logout the user everywhere.
5. I don’t know either.
@kunal can you help, specifically with 4,5,6 as these were your notes?

4. I think session_auto_timeout_minutes is what we want to configure, so we can say this is solved.
5. I’m not sure what those headers do, but Natwest flagged that we didn’t use them.
6. some specific things they flagged: numbers and special characters allowed in first/last name, non-numbers allowed in phone number, html tags allowed in input. This one was marked with very low priority on the report though.
